Popular medical drama, starring Maggie O'Neill, Gray O'Brien and Simon Shepherd

programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the drama. She agrees to investigate but, as her inquiries get under way, another body is discovered. Joan Hickson, Gwen Watford and Moray Watson star

The teenager was sent the digit by a people-smuggler who claims to have her mother and is demanding money for her safe return. Meanwhile, Akka's 12 year-old cousin Sosa is trying to enter the UK illegally hidden in a van on a cross-channel ferry. Emilia Fox stars

programme.desc: Lance is persuaded to try hypnotherapy for an awkward affliction and old enemies are sniffing around as Lance and Andy start finding some decent items

The 150th episode of the rural medical drama, starring Eva Pope and Simon Shepherd

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mummified remains of a woman are found during a rescue operation in a cave, and the body is discovered to be the ex-wife of a chief constable. Dalziel and Pascoe investigate, and their lives are put on the line when they brave treacherous conditions to uncover more evidence at the scene of the find. With Denis Lawson, Reece Dinsdale, Christine Tremarco and Sylivia Syms

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The gun used to kill a boxer is discovered at the scene of an armed robbery 15 years later, prompting the team to reinvestigate the case. Twenty-one-year-old Eddie Mayfair was shot dead a week after winning an important bout, which left his opponent seriously injured and unable to carry on his career. The detectives initially suspect revenge as a motive, but the case is complicated when they uncover the rivalries and money-making aspects of the sport. Guest starring Maggie O'Neill (Shameless) and Chloe Howman (Casualty)

Meanwhile, Thomas is called to the site of the murder of a former drug addict and petty criminal who has been thrown from the top of a flyover, and becomes determined to win justice for the victim in the wake of police indifference - forming an unlikely alliance in the process

Popular medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd, Victor McGuire and Susannah Corbett

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard asks a reluctant Clegg to deliver a message to Marina at her place of employment. Meanwhile, Seymour goes in search of oil, but manages to drill through a water main. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge

programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

Senior paramedic Claire is dispatched to liaise between the hospital and the ambulance service, while the Hazardous Area Response Team prepare to transport the patient to North Manchester General Hospital's Infectious Disease Unit

programme.title: If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)
programme.desc: In early 1970s Harlem, 19-year old Tish Rivers recalls the longtime relationship between her and fianc√© Alonzo 'Fonny' Hunt. With a child on the way, their plans of starting a family and embracing the future are derailed when Fonny is arrested for a crime he did not commit. Director Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring KiKi Layne and Stephan James

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams search for antiques in Exeter, taking on board expert advice provided by Richard Madley and Ben Cooper. Christina Trevanion presents, and also travels to the south-west coast to learn about the history of the sea shanty

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Amanda Tatchell and Julie Middleditch join forces with David Burville to get a treasured baby doll back to its beautiful best by addressing her cracked face and crumbling hands and feet. A worn-out suitcase dating from the Second World War and a seized-up silver locket are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the Conegliano region in the foothills of the Alps, to find out about the production of his favourite tipple Prosecco. One of the country's few female female wine-makers explains about the grapes they use - and when the importance of the harvest - before inviting him to spend the night in a giant wine barrel. Moving on, vintage car fan Clive joins the 100 Miglia rally and hunts for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britain's post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass return to tackle more potential miscarriages of justice as they re-examine historic murder cases on behalf of the family of those convicted. In the first edition they investigate their oldest case yet, the murder of a canal boat passenger 180 years ago in which boatmen were convicted and publicly hanged

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, 34 per cent of the British population worked in manufacturing. Factories mostly employed women, who made an array of clothes and household items that were sold all over the world. Alex Jones presents this documentary in which a group of modern workers go back in time to learn what life was like for women through the 1960s to the 1980s. They start in a re-creation of 1968, when the bulk of high street clothes were made in the UK. The reality of the production line is a rude awakening for many - long monotonous hours with short breaks and few distractions - a situation made even worse when they open their pay packets

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey across Northern Ireland to Argyll and Bute, beginning by travelling from Newry to Portadown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle, where antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jen Brister, Kelvin Fletcher, Ian Moore and Zoe Williams go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef visits a trout farm to learn about sustainable fishing, and builds a cold smoker with the help of his friend and fire expert Chris Taylor

programme.title: Chris and Meg's Wild Summer
programme.desc: Chris Packham and his stepdaughter Megan McCubbin continue their a wildlife-watching road trip by exploring North Wales, where highlights include spotting red kites, feral goats and sand lizards, as well as climbing Snowdon, and having a go on the world's fastest zipwire

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking questions on the specialist subjects of Karl Marx, The Royle Family, the flags of British counties, and Django Reinhardt, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as film fans the Video Nastiestake on family team the Solomons. They must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Green Monster, Small Chandelier, Stone Sausage, and Merrygold Robin

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with four students from the Open University pitting their wits against a team from Hertford College, Oxford in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Murder Trial: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: The trial of William MacDowell continues and the jury members hear the dramatic testimony of Renee's best friend and confidante, while the senior investigating officer retraces MacDowell's steps on the night in question. There is compelling testimony suggesting MacDowell attempted to create a fake alibi, and a final witness is called as the Crown's case nears conclusion

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise has a hangover, but claims it is migraine, brought on by stress from the forthcoming wedding. Jim feels depressed by the rest of the family's insistence on ignoring his wishes and celebrating his birthday, so it is cut-price cakes, family photos and bubbly all round

programme.title: Manhunter (1986)
programme.desc: A former FBI agent is coaxed out of retirement to track down a serial killer behind the slaughter of entire families. The detective needs an angle on the murderer's psychology and the only way to get this insight is to face his nightmares and consult cannibalistic psychopath Dr Hannibal Lecktor in prison. Michael Mann's thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel Red Dragon, with William Petersen, Dennis Farina, Tom Noonan, Brian Cox and Joan Allen

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Matt Baker head to the Usk Valley within Bannau Brycheiniog, and look at a series of projects which aim to lead the National Park into a more sustainable future. However, not everyone has welcomed this change. Plus, Charlotte Smith investigates if the race to protect land for nature could threaten livestock farms, and Adam Henson introduces the first two competitors for this year's one man and his dog competition

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The first of the semi-finals is hosted in County Durham at the Beamish Museum. The contestants are thrown in at the deep end, cooking in tents and using unfamiliar equipment to serve up a four course meal for 100 of the museum's staff and volunteers

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Mother-of-the bride Bernadette outlines an outrageous plan to improve post-apocalyptic life for everyone, but faces opposition. Shelly tries to make amends for her past mistakes. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.desc: Robson is joined by fellow actor Mark Benton to explore the Cleveland and North Yorkshire coast while sampling outdoor activities that promise to be good for the mind and body. programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores the capabilities of bears, who can live in practically every habitat on Earth due to being able to endure extreme conditions. The naturalist examines the specialised adaptations that have enabled the mammals to thrive, including how the hollow fur of polar bears allows them to feed during gruelling winters

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the living history series in which a group of women step back in time to experience factory life in the past. The year has moved on to 1973, when manufacturing output and productivity was at its highest since the war. The women are tasked with bright orange flares, a must-have fashion item of the decade, and with business booming, targets have to be met. However, when a male machinist joins the production line, his end-of-week pay packet sends shockwaves around the factory

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Belfast to Portrush, Michael Portillo investigates the work of author and Narnia creator CS Lewis, and visits the Royal Portrush Golf Club

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as people are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jen Brister, Kelvin Fletcher, Ian Moore and Zoe Williams go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus explores new possibilities on his Sussex smallholding, having noticed more and more deer appearing on his land. He heads off to the Knepp Estate to meet Charlie and Issy, who have turned over their 3,500-acre farm to rewilding, in which deer play a vital role. Back at the farm, Marcus has invited two apprentice chefs to have a foraging masterclass from expert and friend, Colin Wheeler. When it comes to foraging, Marcus is an apprentice too, so along with the young chefs, he's excited to learn what edible plants he has growing unnoticed on his property

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Cargo in a British port grinds to a halt when a tugboat picks up a mystery object in its propeller and is put out of action, while a luxury floating hotel in London's Docklands has a rusty hull and the members of the dive team are charged with making it shipshape once more. They then face danger on the water as they attempt to rescue a stricken cruise liner amid one of winter's worst storms

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: The Barclays are finding their feet with their new business, which involves buying lambs to fatten up for the butcher. Rachel and Camy, who are one year into their tenancy, set off to market at Lairg to buy more ewes, while Nikki and Ollie find out if their favourite buffalo is pregnant

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: With a place in the final at stake, it's an adrenaline overload as the planners compete to transform an old cinema into a 1950s Los Angeles beach club to create a swinging Hollywood-style wedding for Tash and Jay's big day. What will judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya make of their efforts?

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Chief bridesmaid Shelly makes a shocking discovery that could ruin everything for the hens. With time running out, she finds an unexpected ally in beautician-turned-inventor Veena and comes up with a drastic plan of action. Bernadette's business proposal takes an unexpected turn after a post-apocalyptic makeover. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather

programme.title: T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Highlights of the fourth and final match of the series from Trent Bridge, Nottingham. This was the first match between the sides here in this format, but New Zealand did record victories over Sri Lanka and Ireland at this venue during the 2009 ICC World Twenty20

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel to the highlands of central Sri Lanka to learn about Ceylon Tea Trails - a series of colonial era bungalows that have been renovated and revisioned by a local family of tea entrepreneurs. Monica works with the tea pickers and learns the importance of the industry to the country, while Rob tracks leopards in the surrounding plantations. The highlands are a rugged landscape, but as Rob and Monica discover, with dedication and detail, guests can still get a luxury experience

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine learns what's hiding underneath her resentment. Erica connects with Sean. Brock and Kristi reach a potential breaking point

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Keynsham recycling centre in Somerset in search of items to be rescued. She brings furniture painter Chloe Kempster a dressing table in need of attention, while light designer Duncan McKean transforms four glass lampshades. Sarah works on bringing new life to a dead shrub

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals continue, with the candidates joined by rapper, grime MC, songwriter and DJ Big Zuu. They are tasked to recreate one of his favourite recipes - getting to appreciate that food that is very personal to him. The celebrities need to deliver on the techniques, flavours and love that go into these dishes in order to impress Big Zuu and judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrity who outshines the rest will earn a pass straight through to the next round. The remaining six must cook off and make a plate of food that evokes a special time and place in their lives

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple to find a new home closer to their son in Northumbria, and also pays a visit to the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Shropshire to convert Denise and John's simple and inaccessible garden into a wheelchair friendly Italian-inspired outdoor space with a ¬£6,000 budget

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Lara Scott shows viewers around Norfolk Deaf Festival, an annual event that brings the local deaf community together. Deaf yoga teacher Sarah Scott gives Yvonne and Julian a few wellness techniques and reveals how people can access their local yoga class, and there's a tribute to Sinead O'Connor, who famously produced a signed song

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Northern Ireland's spectacular Causeway coast to begin a new journey, which takes him along the north and east coasts through Ulster and Leinster. He begins in Co Derry on the windswept shores of Loch Foyle, where the largest accumulation of coastal sands in Ireland has formed a system of dunes visible from space. He also learns how scientists are monitoring the site and hears how their work has been picked up by fellow scientists in the United States to help research the surface of Mars

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein investigate the mysterious murder of a Yorkshire farm owner in 1933, finding out if a clandestine love affair may have led to a brutal killing

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham learns how foxes have been able to adapt and thrive in a world with an ever-increasing human population. New research reveals how the animals' split pupils enable them to hunt in the bright desert day, and the presenter discusses a theory that the creatures use the Earth's magnetic field to determine the location of their prey

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Time moves on for the volunteers from 1973 to 1976, when disco was dominating the dance floors and maxi dresses were in vogue. It was also a time of great hope for women, with the Sex Discrimination Act having just been passed and the Equal Pay Act now in force. But will the changes in the law lead to equality on the factory floor or will the workers' hopes be dashed once again?

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Northern Ireland across the water to Scotland. Leaving from the seaport of Larne, he reaches Stranraer and the Mull of Galloway, where in a lighthouse built by railway engineer Robert Stevenson he discovers a magnificent machine, installed at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A collection of finds from various locations around the country, including Lulworth Castle in Dorset, Chiddingstone Castle in Kent and Wrest Park, Bedfordshire

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v Sri Lanka. Isa Guha presents live coverage of the third and final match in the series from The Incora County Ground, Derby. England's side will be buoyant, having won two of the three T20s they played against Australia in the recent Ashes series, which included a memorable victory at Lord's. They now face a Sri Lanka side they last met prior to this series at the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. That encounter ended in a victory for the home side, meaning they went into these contests with a 100 per cent record in T20s against the Sri Lankans, with nine wins from nine

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: In the first of two special episodes commemorating the end of the long-running topical comedy series, a chance to see again some of the finest moments from the first half of its 17-year history

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Surviving 9/11
programme.desc: The stories of 13 people caught up in the events of September 11, 2001, moving between accounts of the two-hour period when terrorists attacked the Twin Towers and the Pentagon and hijacked Flight 93 and what has happened in the 20 years since. The film examines what was it like to actually live through such a historic event and how easy it was to move on from a day that society wants to go on remembering

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Lara Scott shows viewers around Norfolk Deaf Festival, an annual event that brings the local deaf community together. Deaf yoga teacher Sarah Scott gives Yvonne and Julian a few wellness techniques and reveals how people can access their local yoga class, and there's a tribute to Sinead O'Connor, who famously produced a signed song

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Sparks fly as the contenders clash over plans for a multi-themed wedding, and with two venues to arrange it turns out to be the toughest challenge yet. Can they pull together and impress judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and Flo go head-to-head to design a garden to match Jo and Jack's Victorian terraced house. They have just ¬£4,500 to tick all the boxes on the couple's extensive wishlist

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last of the semi-final contests sees the celebrities asked to cook the ultimate airline food to celebrate the golden age of travel. Each must create a main course, a side dish and a dessert that will be served in first class style. The celebrities' meal is key to staying on course for the ultimate stage of the competition as at the end of this edition, only the five best cooks will go through to Finals Week. Presented by Gregg Wallace and John Torode

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail trek along the coast of Northumberland continues towards the Farne Islands, takes in the holy island of Lindisfarne, and finishes in England's northernmost town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle and climber Lucy Creamer scale Layer Marney Tower near Colchester to discover the innovations of the Tudor builders and craftsmen, and reveal the connection between Parmesan cheese and the ornate terracotta carvings that decorate the building

programme.title: The Riviera: A History in Pictures
programme.desc: Part one of two. Actor Richard E Grant follows in the footsteps of artists who lived and painted on France's Cote d'Azur, renowned for its sunny climate. The first edition focuses on the relationship between modern art and the location's development as an international tourist haven. Cezanne, Monet and Renoir were captivated by the light and colour of the landscape in the 19th century and their resultant work advertised the region's beauty. Meanwhile, the area's vivid hues inspired Henri Matisse to adopt a new palette that set modern art on the route to abstraction

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: Art historian James Fox explores how New Zealand's indigenous Maori people resisted colonisation and marginalisation, and maintained their distinctive culture, so much so that it is now an integral part of modern New Zealand and celebrated all over the world. He shows how, from the beginning of their encounters with Europeans, the Maori adapted outside influences, whether it was modern firearms or the new religion of Christianity, and produced fascinating hybrid work that ranged from elaborately carved rifle butts to a Madonna and Child statue adorned with the Ta Moko, the sacred Maori facial tattoo

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian examines how writers, politicians and artists have manipulated the history of the Spanish Armada. She takes a look at the most famous parts of the story, from Francis Drake's game of bowls to Elizabeth I rousing her troops at Tilbury, and reveals how in Victorian times, the story was used as propaganda for the British Empire

programme.title: Invasion! with Sam Willis
programme.desc: The historian reveals a story of invasion in Britain spanning millennia, beginning with him felling a tree with a flint axe in Kent, and riding an Iron Age chariot. Sam Willis also searches for clues of invasion at Silbury Hill, and tracks down evidence of the Beaker people, who brought ceramics, metalwork and beakers to Britain

programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert continues to explore the Canadian wilderness and learns about the history of the Hudson's Bay Company, which dealt in fur and was established in 1670. Ray examines the skills used by the business's early traders and trappers, gaining an insight into how they laid the foundations for modern Canada

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail trek along the coast of Northumberland continues towards the Farne Islands, takes in the holy island of Lindisfarne, and finishes in England's northernmost town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle and climber Lucy Creamer scale Layer Marney Tower near Colchester to discover the innovations of the Tudor builders and craftsmen, and reveal the connection between Parmesan cheese and the ornate terracotta carvings that decorate the building

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: An examination of humankind's rise to dominance, focusing on the facilities that separate humans from other animals and promote the desire for self-knowledge

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian examines how writers, politicians and artists have manipulated the history of the Spanish Armada. She takes a look at the most famous parts of the story, from Francis Drake's game of bowls to Elizabeth I rousing her troops at Tilbury, and reveals how in Victorian times, the story was used as propaganda for the British Empire

programme.title: Secret Life of Farm Animals
programme.desc: The documentary examining the behaviour of farm animals follows the first 12 weeks in the life of a Hereford calf, as it makes friends and settles into the herd. The films reveals how cows are highly social animals with complex personalities. They are also brilliant problem solvers with a love of music. Plus, how many clucks chickens use to communicate

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a trip from the Firth of Clyde to Lewis and Harris in the Outer Hebrides, beginning with a visit to a nuclear power station on the Hunterston Peninsula. He then learns about Largs' Viking past and admires one of the most beautiful railway stations in Britain at Wemyss Bay. The importance of ferries to connect western Scotland with its many islands becomes plain to Michael at Port Glasgow in the deep waters of the Clyde, where he visits Ferguson Marine, builders of Calmac ferries

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Convinced he is a complete failure in life, Frank pays a visit to a psychiatrist. After a few minutes in his company, the unfortunate doctor finds himself in need of counselling. Classic comedy, guest starring Bernard Hepton, with Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and Roger Allam

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An account of how the Jewish National Fund acquired land in Palestine before and after the creation of the State of Israel. Film-maker Michal Weits' great-grandfather was a key figure in the organisation and is celebrated as the father of the country's forests. But when Michal finds his private diaries, she discovers a very different story. In conversations with her family, she questions her great-grandfather's actions, resulting in an exploration of Israel's past and an uncomfortable truth

programme.title: The Violence Paradox
programme.desc: Psychologist Steven Pinker journeys through history and the human mind to explore what triggers violence and how it may have decreased over time. In the first of two programmes, research includes clues from a prehistoric archaeological dig in Kenya, an experiment to test the moral judgement of babies and data analysis of 239 years of Old Bailey proceedings

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Highlights of Michael Parkinson's interviews with leading actresses Bette Midler, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Bette Davis, Raquel Welch, Shirley MacLaine, Gloria Swanson and Miss Piggy

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a trip from the Firth of Clyde to Lewis and Harris in the Outer Hebrides, beginning with a visit to a nuclear power station on the Hunterston Peninsula. He then learns about Largs' Viking past and admires one of the most beautiful railway stations in Britain at Wemyss Bay. programme.title: Secret Life of Farm Animals

The films reveals how cows are highly social animals with complex personalities. They are also brilliant problem solvers with a love of music. Plus, how many clucks chickens use to communicate

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: Art historian James Fox explores how New Zealand's indigenous Maori people resisted colonisation and marginalisation, and maintained their distinctive culture, so much so that it is now an integral part of modern New Zealand and celebrated all over the world. He shows how, from the beginning of their encounters with Europeans, the Maori adapted outside influences, whether it was modern firearms or the new religion of Christianity, and produced fascinating hybrid work that ranged from elaborately carved rifle butts to a Madonna and Child statue adorned with the Ta Moko, the sacred Maori facial tattoo

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Scotland's spectacular west coast from the Firth of Clyde to the Outer Hebrides. From the 250-year old 'new town' of Helensburgh on the north bank of the Clyde, Michael takes his favourite West Highland Line across epic landscapes to Garelochhead and Ben Cruachan, and makes his way to Connel Bridge and the waters of Loch Etive

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Jonathan Foyle is aided by Lucy Creamer as he climbs Burghley House in Lincolnshire, which was built to impress Queen Elizabeth I on her many trips around the country. He scales the roof to view a playground of hidden ornate sculpture where royalty and ambassadors were entertained, and deciphers the mysterious symbols that adorn the structure

programme.title: Caligula with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Roman emperor Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus - better known as Caligula - was said to have made his horse a consul, proclaimed himself a living God and indulged in scandalous orgies. In this documentary, classical scholar Mary Beard attempts to peel away some of the myths surrounding him, sifting through surviving evidence to paint a portrait of the real Caligula

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: All Roman rulers put great value on spectacles and games, but only one, the son of Marcus Aurelius, steps out of the Imperial Box and onto the sands of the arena. As Emperor Commodus makes enemies amongst the ruling Senate, a deadly game of cat and mouse ensues

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: By the 4th century AD, a divided Roman Empire is rocked by devastating earthquakes, fires, barbarian invasions and deep religious divides. As Rome declines, the Colosseum, which once stood as a proud symbol of the Empire's glory, lies empty. To restore Rome, one man, a devout worshipper of the Rome's old gods, turns to the arena

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: The Praetorian Guard hold Claudius under protective custody as the Senate debates the return of the Republic. Messalina enjoys the trappings of power and talks her husband into recalling Appius Silanus from Spain so he can marry her mother, and the engineers are ordered to survey Ostia for all weather harbour improvements

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: As Claudius continues his conquest of Britain, Messalina runs wild with lust. After competing in a tournament of sex, in which she takes on the champion of the Guild of Prostitutes, Sylla, she begins a rebellion of her own. However, her decision to proceed with a divorce and publicly marry new lover Silius leads to disastrous consequences. Derek Jacobi and Sheila White star

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: As he approaches the end of his years, Claudius is urged to re-marry and decides upon the scheming Agrippinilla as his new spouse - despite knowing she will try to make her son Nero the emperor. Derek Jacobi stars

Jessica cooks cabbage and spring onions in oil and then adds them to grated carrot, beetroot, potatoes and a tomato and stock mixture. All of these ingredients are combined in a casserole dish. Once they are stirred together, the casserole dish can be placed in the oven to cook. Jessica wears a traditional Ukrainian outfit and serves drinks in a beautiful drinks dispenser. Maddie explores plants in the rainforest, big and small, and sees how the clever drip-tip leaves work watering the plants beneath them. We‚Äôll see how plants in hot, dry parts of world like the desert thrive in their own special ways, like the cactus plant that stores litres of water in its waxy leaves. programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The five remaining cooks travel to East Sussex to Hunter Gather Cook, where the nation's top chefs learn how to forage and cook over open fire. Back in the MasterChef kitchen, the celebrities must each create an exceptional dish inspired by somebody they admire to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies
programme.desc: Rob takes his opportunity to get closer to Cheryl by making a generous offer to help her charitable trust after he realises she is the only person that can access the bank account. programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Adebayo Akinfenwa leads a session on using power and size. There's joy as one player scores a contract, and tough decisions as two more fall behind. While one says he disagrees with the coaches' analysis, the other feels he has to work on his fitness if he is to make any progress. With Roman Kemp

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher works on a mantle clock in the shape of a ship, a treasured gift from the owner's late grandfather. programme.title: Being Louis Rees-Zammit
programme.desc: Unfiltered access to rugby's new superstar. Includes contributions from team-mate Dan Biggar and World Cup Winner and top try scorer, Bryan Habana

programme.title: If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)
programme.desc: In early 1970s Harlem, 19-year old Tish Rivers recalls the longtime relationship between her and fianc√© Alonzo 'Fonny' Hunt. With a child on the way, their plans of starting a family and embracing the future are derailed when Fonny is arrested for a crime he did not commit. Director Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring KiKi Layne and Stephan James

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve and Martin learn the truth about Stacey's stalker but Theo intercepts their warning messages to her. Gina humiliates Cindy in the Vic and Ben and Lexi prepare for her first day of secondary school. Lily goes into labour

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Vaping among Britain's teenagers is on the rise and there's growing concern some companies are targeting under-age vapers. So, should we be worried about young people getting addicted? Rachel Burden investigates the youth vaping phenomenon and talks to young people, parents, and experts about how to tackle it

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and a team of ethical hackers hunt down the scammers plaguing people's lives, using cutting-edge technology to monitor fraudsters' phone calls

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jailed: Inside Maghaberry Prison
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan enters the notorious high-security Maghaberry Prison to meet the inmates and see for himself the pressures that the system is facing. In the first episode, Stephen talks to a convicted murderer, sees how jail staff try to turn lives around and is confronted by the sometimes shocking reality of life inside

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop are joined by a variety of guest hosts and panellists from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs in this compilation edition revisiting the big news stories of 2022

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a ¬£10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are siblings Mairi and Alastair from Glasgow, mother and daughter Angela and Riziki from Brighton, and couple Mina and Paul from Birmingham and London

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two paramedics recall their experiences at the scene of the London Bridge attacks, where in June 2017 a van was deliberately driven into pedestrians. In Manchester, the police launch a new initiative to crack down on knife crime

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Detectives enlist the help of a fibre and DNA specialist in their hunt for the killer of a young woman from Bolton and police seek the help of a bodily fluid expert after a bizarre rampage in the Cotswolds

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell meet the new owners of some terraces in Durham and Beddau and a majestic looking period semi-detached in Crewe to hear about their renovation plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the competition from Heanor Antiques Centre in Derbyshire, where teams are guided by experts Catherine Southon and Thomas Forrester as they try to find three interesting items that might generate a profit at auction. Natasha also finds out about the value of provenance

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Al and Scarlett treat a very angry patient and Ruhma has an unexpected encounter. What's next for Daniel and Zara?

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and her team of creatives upcycle a display cabinet in need of a little TLC, a water-damaged chest of drawers and a set of handmade curtains

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A retired opera singer and a soon-to-be retired music teacher have decided it's time to return to the UK after spending the last 25 years in Holland. With Alistair Appleton's help, the pair search for a new home in Somerset or Gloucestershire

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Shropshire to convert Denise and John's simple and inaccessible garden into a wheelchair friendly Italian-inspired outdoor space with a ¬£6,000 budget

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win ¬£5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey is trapped in the kitchen while Jean attempts to support Lily through labour. Ben encourages Lexi to open up but Callum is worried about him. Ian has a brainwave and invites Nish for lunch

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The five remaining cooks travel to East Sussex to Hunter Gather Cook, where the nation's top chefs learn how to forage and cook over open fire. Guided by founder and head chef Nick Weston, the contestants use only open flame to make a three-course meal for 20 of the country's top Scouts who are completing their survival badge. Back in the MasterChef kitchen, the celebrities must each create an exceptional dish inspired by somebody they admire to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies
programme.desc: Rob takes his opportunity to get closer to Cheryl by making a generous offer to help her charitable trust after he realises she is the only person that can access the bank account. Alice uses Cheryl's toy poodle Goblin as a way to get inside information on Rob but things don't go to plan when the pair end up coming face to face in Cheryl's hallway

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: Adebayo Akinfenwa leads a session on using power and size. There's joy as one player scores a contract, and tough decisions as two more fall behind. The coaches want to give them honest feedback, rather than offer false hope. While one says he disagrees with the coaches' analysis, the other feels he has to work on his fitness if he is to make any progress. With Roman Kemp

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England and rugby union player Jonny Hill, Olympic Gold medal winning swimmer Freya Anderson, world champion gymnast Joe Fraser and former Everton midfielder Leon Osman join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A fire crew in Burnley come under attack on their busiest night of the year and in Swindon, two paramedics are violently assaulted by a patient. Derbyshire police tackle the drug gangs crossing their county lines

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A British facial reconstruction expert helps uncover the identity of a body washed up on a Dutch beach and a forensic linguistic specialist leads the hunt for evidence against an Edinburgh bomber

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is delighted with the quirky original features he finds in a house in Staffordshire, and Tommy Walsh meets a sports insurer who is keen to try out his DIY skills on an end-of-terrace in Suffolk. Martin Roberts, meanwhile, is surprised by the extra benefits that come with a pair of old garages in south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents as two teams search for antiques in Leominster, Herefordshire, led by experts Kate Bliss and Tim Weeks. Christina learns about 'The Leominster Chelsea Bun', which travelled to the battlefields of the First World War and back

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rosie has a surprising request for Barry and the Mill staff deal with the events of the previous night. Suni meets a young man who is trying to cope with the ghosts of his past

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Wallyford recycling centre, JJ Chalmers finds a glass fronted cabinet for Joel Poole to fix-up, an old wicker trunk for Sarah Peterson to makeover and a pair of wooden doors that he plans on upcycling himself

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is on a property-searching mission in the Devon countryside, helping a mother and daughter duo with ¬£750,000 find a home for three generations of their family and an eco-camping business. The presenter also visits Chagford Community Farm, one of the UK's first community-supported micro-dairies and sees how residents are readily signing up to buying its local produce

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull visit Doris and Petra in Stoke on Trent who want to turn their higledy-piggledy garden full of trip hazards, into a safe space inspired by the German meadows that surrounded Doris's childhood home with a budget of ¬£4,000

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win ¬£5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's business lunch with Suki and Nish doesn't go to plan and Peter tries to make amends with Gina and Anna. Sonia and Reiss head to their first fertility appointment and Freddie is consumed by guilt

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher works on a mantle clock in the shape of a ship, a treasured gift from the owner's late grandfather. Kirsten Ramsay is called upon to painstakingly piece together a vintage ceramic night light, fractured into dozens of fragments, and skateboard enthusiast Mike is hoping Will Kirk and Dominic Chinea can restore his wooden board, which transports him back to his youth in 1960s Liverpool. Finally, toy restorers Julie and Amanda undertake the repair of a treasured teddy bear that has been by the side of a young man as he's undergone life-changing surgery

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining chefs must create a theatrical showstopping dish which will decide who makes it to the next challenge. The final three then face the Chef's Table hosted by Robin Gill. The finalists must deliver exceptional food to a table of professional restaurateurs including Raymond Blanc, Daniel Clifford, Anna Haugh, Nieves Barragan Mohacho and Matt Gillan

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The North West Ambulance Service is alerted about a possible outbreak of the highly infectious Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) at Fairfield General Hospital in Bury. Senior paramedic Claire is dispatched to liaise between the hospital and the ambulance service, while the Hazardous Area Response Team prepare to transport the patient to North Manchester General Hospital's Infectious Disease Unit

programme.title: If Beale Street Could Talk (2018)
programme.desc: In early 1970s Harlem, 19-year old Tish Rivers recalls the longtime relationship between her and fianc√© Alonzo 'Fonny' Hunt. With a child on the way, their plans of starting a family and embracing the future are derailed when Fonny is arrested for a crime he did not commit. Director Barry Jenkins' Oscar-winning drama, starring KiKi Layne and Stephan James

programme.title: The National Television Awards
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the 28th edition of the ceremony, as stars and fans gather for one of the biggest nights in British TV, broadcast from The O2 in London. The NTAs celebrate television's best-loved shows and stars in the only TV award ceremony where the winners are chosen entirely by viewers. The big names in contention this year include Happy Valley stars Sarah Lancashire and James Norton, Alison Hammond, moneysaving maestro Martin Lewis, Graham Norton, Piers Morgan, Louis Theroux and Scottish superstar Lewis Capaldi. Paul O'Grady will also receive a posthumous nomination for the final series of For the Love of Dogs, as will Deborah James for her powerful documentary, Bowelbabe in Her Own Words

programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the 28th edition of the ceremony, as stars and fans gather for one of the biggest nights in British TV, broadcast from The O2 in London. The NTAs celebrate television's best-loved shows and stars in the only TV award ceremony where the winners are chosen entirely by viewers. The big names in contention this year include Happy Valley stars Sarah Lancashire and James Norton, Alison Hammond, moneysaving maestro Martin Lewis, Graham Norton, Piers Morgan, Louis Theroux and Scottish superstar Lewis Capaldi. Paul O'Grady will also receive a posthumous nomination for the final series of For the Love of Dogs, as will Deborah James for her powerful documentary, Bowelbabe in Her Own Words

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A mother's pregnancy stirs up feelings of jealousy and resentment in her son, who suffers from spina bifida, and a fight at the newly merged Scorpions and Giants' first match doesn't bode well for the future. Steven and Jacqui patch up their differences, while Simon and Ruth still fail to agree. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Michael Jowett and Katherine Dow Blyton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's niece comes to stay in Aidensfield following the breakdown of her marriage, but immediately suffers another blow when her prize racehorse is kidnapped and held to ransom. Romance is in the air for Rosie as a biker gang turns up in town, and a seedy photographer promises to make a star of Phil Bellamy's stepdaughter Jane. Rural drama, starring Vanessa Hehir and Lauren Drummond

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local farmer Colin Judd is devastated when he is forced to place his property in the hands of an auctioneer following the death of his father - but is even more shocked to see his estranged brother at the sale. Debbie Bellamy finds herself in trouble for drink-driving, and David has difficulty with a stubborn pony meant to be pulling a trap full of tourists. Rural drama, with David Lonsdale

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Pollard finds the stash of dodgy mobile phones, while Steph walks out on her date with Shadrach - who responds by telling Zak their deal is off and disappearing on the eve of his court appearance.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lucy admits to Peter that she needs help looking after the baby, Martin gets jealous at the hospital staff party when one of the porters makes a play for Katy, and Hayley catches Tracy flirting with Roy

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tommy teases Martin about his new girlfriend, oblivious to the fact it is his own daughter. Bev's suspicions about Peter grow, prompting her to confront Ciaran for some answers. Karen begins to regret returning to Weatherfield

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morse's outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but it's not long before he's questioning DI Fred Thursday's orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bernie becomes the target of a series of mysterious and violent attacks, while Peggy is forced to intervene after David finds he can't match the other contestants in an angling competition. Helen is horrified by the arrival of her estranged father in Aidensfield - but he has a bombshell to drop that causes her to rethink their relationship. Rural drama, starring Peter Benson and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Debbie Bellamy goes on a late-night drinking spree by the river, but her actions get her into trouble when evidence ties her to the spot where a body is fished out of the water. Rob and Helen try to patch up their relationship, while Peggy and David are appalled to find a hippie encampment in the back yard - until they realise there's money to be made. Rural drama, with Josefina Gabrielle

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective has been assigned to a quiet rural area in 1969, and finds himself back in uniform. However, he is reunited with his former CID colleagues when he discovers the body of a missing schoolgirl. Endeavour quickly finds a likely suspect, and is offered the chance to regain his lost status by making an arrest - but Thursday convinces him the man is innocent

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: DCI Colin Sutton is asked to review the police investigation into a series of rapes, sexual assaults and burglaries that took place in south-east London between 1992 and 2009. Working with Det Supt Simon Morgan and the Operation Minstead team, the detective proposed a strategy he believed could catch one of Britain's most prolific rapists. Fact-based crime drama, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: A recent life-changing medical diagnosis has thrown psychologist Joe O'Loughlin off-balance, and he is feeling reckless. When a young woman is found murdered, the unusual manner of her death prompts DS Riya Devi to suggest asking Joe for a professional opinion. Joe is shocked by the sight of the body - but is he just shaken by the brutality of the killing or is there something from his past he's not telling the police? Thriller, starring Aidan Turner, Shaun Parkes and Anjli Mohindra

programme.desc: As everyone prepares for the wedding of the year, Bev is still convinced Peter is going to break her daughter's heart and urges Shelley to confront him before she makes the biggest mistake of her life

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuth's passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Miller's old Army captain shows up to make him a business proposition, which he turns down without regret. Meanwhile, Gina is reluctant to let Jack paint her in the nude. Rural Sixties drama, with John Duttine and Jonathan Kerrigan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Despite Rob's efforts to keep his wedding secret, his sisters enlist the help of the community to organise a surprise reception as the policeman prepares to marry Helen. Drama, with Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Saint's bones are discovered during an archaeological dig, causing a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. However, when the dig's leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are presented with a complex investigation as they hunt for the perpetrator. As the duo unearth more evidence, they soon discover that it is not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Fiona Dolman and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: Colin presents his review findings to DCS Hamish Campbell and suggests a strategy called 'Minstead Lite', but Hamish wants Colin to stay on to see this new approach through. Meanwhile, DC Spier's informant suggests that she has found one of the pieces of jewellery that was stolen from a Minstead victim. Fact-based crime drama, starring Martin Clunes, Matt Bardock and Guy Williams

programme.desc: Joe just can't get the case of the murdered woman out of his head and is convinced there's something sinister at play, with his paranoia leading him to suspect that one of his patients may know something about the killing. programme.desc: On what should be the happiest day of her life, Shelley is wondering whether to go through with the wedding in light of Peter's bombshell. Mum Bev is adamant she shouldn't, but Peter is a very persuasive man - will he win his bride-to-be round?

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield's policemen struggle to deduce who could be behind a spate of sheep rustling, while Peggy is intrigued by an eco-warrior couple's slurry-fuelled generator. Drama, starring Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally decides the time has come for a confrontation with Rosie's teacher. Elsewhere, Steve urges Karen to give their marriage another try

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: After a lecture from a suspicious Bev, Peter resolves to put Lucy out of his mind and get on with the wedding plans, while Sunita plays Ciaran off against Dev

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are chosen to go on a training course. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are assigned by Blakey to take a class of rowdy schoolchildren on their annual outing. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simmering tensions in the Goddard household come to a head as Ruth gives Simon his marching orders, enraged to discover he's remortgaged the house without consulting her. Meanwhile, Stephen reacts badly to the news that fellow teacher Martin Williams has attempted suicide - and responds by seeking solace in Jacqui's arms. Sarah Lancashire, Jason Done, Pam Ferris and Tony Haygarth star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A mother's pregnancy stirs up feelings of jealousy and resentment in her son, who suffers from spina bifida, and a fight at the newly merged Scorpions and Giants' first match doesn't bode well for the future. Steven and Jacqui patch up their differences, while Simon and Ruth still fail to agree. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Michael Jowett and Katherine Dow Blyton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's niece comes to stay in Aidensfield following the breakdown of her marriage, but immediately suffers another blow when her prize racehorse is kidnapped and held to ransom. Romance is in the air for Rosie as a biker gang turns up in town, and a seedy photographer promises to make a star of Phil Bellamy's stepdaughter Jane. Rural drama, starring Vanessa Hehir and Lauren Drummond

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local farmer Colin Judd is devastated when he is forced to place his property in the hands of an auctioneer following the death of his father - but is even more shocked to see his estranged brother at the sale. Debbie Bellamy finds herself in trouble for drink-driving, and David has difficulty with a stubborn pony meant to be pulling a trap full of tourists. Rural drama, with David Lonsdale

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Pollard finds the stash of dodgy mobile phones, while Steph walks out on her date with Shadrach - who responds by telling Zak their deal is off and disappearing on the eve of his court appearance.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chastity catches Shadrach stealing money from the Dingles, making him feel so guilty that he turns up in court as promised. Zoe invites Ashley and Laurel over for dinner, while Charity snubs Cain and insists her future lies with the King family

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lucy admits to Peter that she needs help looking after the baby, Martin gets jealous at the hospital staff party when one of the porters makes a play for Katy, and Hayley catches Tracy flirting with Roy

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tommy teases Martin about his new girlfriend, oblivious to the fact it is his own daughter. Bev's suspicions about Peter grow, prompting her to confront Ciaran for some answers. Karen begins to regret returning to Weatherfield

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morse's outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but it's not long before he's questioning DI Fred Thursday's orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bernie becomes the target of a series of mysterious and violent attacks, while Peggy is forced to intervene after David finds he can't match the other contestants in an angling competition. Helen is horrified by the arrival of her estranged father in Aidensfield - but he has a bombshell to drop that causes her to rethink their relationship. Rural drama, starring Peter Benson and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Debbie Bellamy goes on a late-night drinking spree by the river, but her actions get her into trouble when evidence ties her to the spot where a body is fished out of the water. Rob and Helen try to patch up their relationship, while Peggy and David are appalled to find a hippie encampment in the back yard - until they realise there's money to be made. Rural drama, with Josefina Gabrielle

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective has been assigned to a quiet rural area in 1969, and finds himself back in uniform. However, he is reunited with his former CID colleagues when he discovers the body of a missing schoolgirl. Endeavour quickly finds a likely suspect, and is offered the chance to regain his lost status by making an arrest - but Thursday convinces him the man is innocent

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: DCI Colin Sutton is asked to review the police investigation into a series of rapes, sexual assaults and burglaries that took place in south-east London between 1992 and 2009. Working with Det Supt Simon Morgan and the Operation Minstead team, the detective proposed a strategy he believed could catch one of Britain's most prolific rapists. Fact-based crime drama, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: A recent life-changing medical diagnosis has thrown psychologist Joe O'Loughlin off-balance, and he is feeling reckless. When a young woman is found murdered, the unusual manner of her death prompts DS Riya Devi to suggest asking Joe for a professional opinion. Joe is shocked by the sight of the body - but is he just shaken by the brutality of the killing or is there something from his past he's not telling the police? Thriller, starring Aidan Turner, Shaun Parkes and Anjli Mohindra

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity discovers Jimmy King disapproves of her presence at Holdgate Farm and begins making alternative arrangements, while Scott comforts a distraught Zoe, who confesses she couldn't manage without him

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bev gets the bit between her teeth, determined to prove Peter has another woman, and Martin struggles to handle the guilt over his secret relationship with Katy - especially when it causes him to neglect David

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As everyone prepares for the wedding of the year, Bev is still convinced Peter is going to break her daughter's heart and urges Shelley to confront him before she makes the biggest mistake of her life

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuth's passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Miller's old Army captain shows up to make him a business proposition, which he turns down without regret. However, when Walker and Belay are called to investigate a vehicle theft, it becomes clear the sergeant's old friend has other matters to take care of in Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Gina is reluctant to let Jack paint her in the nude. Rural Sixties drama, with John Duttine and Jonathan Kerrigan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Despite Rob's efforts to keep his wedding secret, his sisters enlist the help of the community to organise a surprise reception as the policeman prepares to marry Helen. A man's complaint about noisy neighbours turns sour when his mentally ill wife takes matters into her own hands, and Gina learns Jack's nude painting of her is to go on public display. Drama, with Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Saint's bones are discovered during an archaeological dig, causing a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. However, when the dig's leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson are presented with a complex investigation as they hunt for the perpetrator. As the duo unearth more evidence, they soon discover that it is not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Fiona Dolman and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: Colin presents his review findings to DCS Hamish Campbell and suggests a strategy called 'Minstead Lite', but Hamish wants Colin to stay on to see this new approach through. Meanwhile, DC Spier's informant suggests that she has found one of the pieces of jewellery that was stolen from a Minstead victim. Fact-based crime drama, starring Martin Clunes, Matt Bardock and Guy Williams

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: Joe just can't get the case of the murdered woman out of his head and is convinced there's something sinister at play, with his paranoia leading him to suspect that one of his patients may know something about the killing. Meanwhile, Ruiz and Devi are hunting for new evidence in their case when a surprising breakthrough turns the spotlight back onto Joe, whose marriage is then hit by a bombshell

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott declares his feelings for Zoe but receives a humiliating rebuff and ends up spending the night with Chloe. Jack turns down the offer of a holiday with Diane, while Katie decides to go and stay with her mum

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: On what should be the happiest day of her life, Shelley is wondering whether to go through with the wedding in light of Peter's bombshell. Mum Bev is adamant she shouldn't, but Peter is a very persuasive man - will he win his bride-to-be round?

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield's policemen struggle to deduce who could be behind a spate of sheep rustling, while Peggy is intrigued by an eco-warrior couple's slurry-fuelled generator. Helen is called in after the body of an elderly woman is found in the river, while the dead woman's son finds it difficult to deal with the consequences of his mother's demise. Drama, starring Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: When a woman is involved in a hit-and-run following a local dance, Miller finds himself racing to discover the identity of the culprit. Meanwhile, David decides he has had enough of Peggy's miserly ways and walks out on the taxi service

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: When a housewife is found hanged in her home, the police initially mark it down as suicide. However, a meeting with an Oxford law professor prompts a sceptical Lewis and Hathaway to believe something more sinister is afoot - a suspicion confirmed by the death of another woman. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: With absolutely no guarantee it will work, the Force Tasking Group have to come to a decision about funding Colin's high stakes gamble. Meanwhile, the news of a new and very vicious attack on an elderly lady makes the team all the more determined to catch their prey. Fact-based crime drama about the police investigation to bring serial killer Levi Bellfield to justice. Starring Martin Clunes, Sule Rimi and Steve Nicolson

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: The rift between Joe and his wife Julianne sees him at his lowest ebb, but he is still determined to untangle the web he is caught up in. He believes that there's a pattern to be found amongst all the coincidences and a breakthrough sets him on a new path of investigation. Meanwhile, DI Ruiz and DS Devi are newly determined to get justice for Catherine, but their own enquiries have hit a roadblock
