programme.title: Ukraine: Holocaust Ground Zero
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Nazi invasion of Ukraine, then part of the Soviet Union, in 1941, which resulted in some of the most horrific acts of genocide of the Second World War. These events that still cast a long shadow over the country, as Vladimir Putin continues to make baseless claims about neo-Nazism in Ukraine to justify Russia's invasion of 2022. Featuring contributions from Holocaust survivors and leading historians

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An on-call stroke doctor has a busy shift in the resus department, and shares his personal experiences of working on the front line during the first week of the pandemic. When a 19-year-old is treated for injuries sustained in a motorbike crash, his mother reflects on leaving her children in Colombia in search of a better life for them abroad. Other patients include a builder with an ankle injury sustained playing basketball, and a 72-year-old with a suspected stroke

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Hotels
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at some of Britain's grandest hotels during a challenging time for the hospitality industry. The first episode focuses on the Langham in London, where a suite can cost up to ¬£25,000 a night, and follows staff as they prepare to reopen after lockdown. To celebrate the reopening, there's a brand-new take on the traditional afternoon tea, with celebrity chef Michel Roux Jr in charge of the revamped menu

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels across the United States in search of restaurants in dire need of renovation - and after analysing their situation, he has just 24 hours to bring them back from the brink of disaster. His first stop is the New York community of Congers, where he hopes to save family-run Italian restaurant Bella Gianna's. programme.desc: Susan and her campervan Helen arrive on home turf, touring the breath-taking southern Highlands of Scotland on a 140-mile trek from Glasgow to Aberfoyle. At Loch Lomond, the comedian takes to a kayak and hits the water to get a unique view of the amazing local scenery. She visits the spectacular Falls of Dochart, where she gets special access to the stunningly beautiful island of Inchbuie. She also views a bizarre Iron Age-style dwelling, known as a crannog, erected on stilts in Loch Tay

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets an owner struggling to work from home because of his disruptive dog, and a music teacher with a whippet-cross that constantly interrupts her recitals. Graeme also meets a couple who are worried that their excitable dog Nala may be too boisterous around their new baby

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: A freak accident leaves a young Irish Wolfhound stuck in a tiny gap between two walls, and Peter treats a pet fish brought to the practice in a bucket of water. Elsewhere, Matt Smith has to perform a rare and complex operation, and Julian Norton treats some sheep feet and helps himself to a tasty farm shop treat

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dan & Helen's Pennine Adventure
programme.desc: On the last leg of their adventure, Dan Walker and Helen Skelton are in the north Pennines, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty close to Helen's Cumbria home. Helen introduces Dan to one of her favourite Cumbrian villages, Dufton, where she joins a local running club on a steep fell run up Dufton Pike. Dan heads to Slaggyford, where he takes a ride on the South Tynedale Railway - the highest narrow-gauge railway in the north of England, with spectacular views for all five miles of the journey

programme.title: Who Killed Lin & Megan Russell?
programme.desc: A look at the complex story of the 1996 murders of Lin Russell and her six-year-old daughter Megan as they walked home from school in Chillenden, Kent, a brutal crime that shocked the nation. Despite a lack of forensic evidence, Michael Stone was convicted, and the verdict was upheld at a 2001 re-trial, but in 2022 convicted killer Levi Bellfield reportedly claimed responsibility for the murders, prompting more questions about Stone's guilt. Featuring testimony from experts in policing, forensics and criminology, as wel as people who worked and reported on the case, this documentary tells the story of one of the most controversial and tragic criminal cases that Britain has ever witnessed

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan returns to uncover the truth behind the horrific crimes of Peterborough serial killer Joanna Dennehy

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Dave Naylor responds to a call after a man with a history of violence is suspected of having stolen a car, which is pursued at 95mph along the M1, while police receive information about a man suspected of trying to sell a car for ¬£1,000 and then driving off with both the vehicle and the cash

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue
programme.desc: A look at why pine martens may be protectors of Britain's native red squirrels, and how to rescue a swan stuck up a tree in a storm

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Liverpool cathedral is the Church of England's newest cathedral, and the largest in Britain. It was designed in the Gothic style by Giles Gilbert Scott, who also designed the red telephone box. It took 74 years to build and was paid for by money donated from the people of Liverpool. National tragedies such as the sinking of the Titanic - many of whose crew came from Liverpool - and the Hillsborough football disaster are remembered within its walls. It is also where Paul McCartney composed and performed his first classical piece of music, the Liverpool Oratorio

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: The life and work of Pieter Bruegel the Elder, generally considered the greatest Flemish painter of the 16th century, whose works remain among the most distinctive examples of Renaissance art, combining gritty humour with political comment. Tim Marlow reveals how Bruegel was influenced by the period of immense social change in which he lived

programme.title: My Mother's Secret (2019)
programme.desc: Soon after meeting her long-lost biological mother, Ashley finds herself caught in a web of lies and deceit. Drama, starring Nia Roam and Laurie Fortier

programme.title: The Cruise: Fun-Loving Brits at Sea
programme.desc: As the cruise conquers its longest sail of the week, the holiday-makers spend a full day on the ship, and decide to throw themselves into the ship's schedule of activities

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian's second run of excursions begins on the Norfolk Broads, where she is invited aboard a beautifully restored boat known as a wherry. Moving onto Cromer, Susan has come for the famous crab, but also discovers the local jig dolls. Part puppet, part percussion instrument, it leads to a very happy time in a pub

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Into the Grand Canyon with Nick Knowles
programme.desc: Part one of two. The presenter adventures through the perilous Grand Canyon, zip-lining over it and battling vertigo to examine the mile-deep chasm from every vantage point. Nick exchanges gifts with the Hualapai tribe whose ancestors used to roam the Canyon, explores the caves 21 storeys below the surface, and takes part in a project to restore the region's endangered condor population

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Norfolk and Suffolk
programme.desc: Celebrating the beauty of Norfolk and Suffolk, from wild coastlines and deep forests to rich farmlands. The first episode follows skipper Richard Mathews in Norfolk as he boards one of the last of the Cromer Crab Boats, before cameras head inland to follow Darren Cox, a trader in the Suffolk town of Sudbury. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: James Bulger: The Trial
programme.desc: The story of the 1993 murder trial of Jon Venables and Robert Thompson, the two 10-year-old killers of toddler James Bulger. Using transcripts from the trial, first-hand testimony of those who were in the courtroom, and reconstruction of key moments in court, this feature-length documentary reveals the prosecution's strategy to prove that both boys were as guilty as each other. With contributions from the prosecution and defence teams, journalists and James Bulger's mother

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: A woman collapses unexpectedly during a day out with her family to an adventure park, and is left unable to move or walk. The trauma team leader diagnoses a bleed on her brain that requires urgent surgery. A neurosurgeon attempts to drain the build-up of fluid in her brain. A motorist suffers a cardiac arrest behind the wheel, caused by a large clot in an artery, and a van driver is airlifted to hospital after a major traffic collision

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Niaz Waddington is trying to keep a low profile in an unmarked car as he attempts to catch up to a vehicle with cloned plates on the M56. With assistance from PC Mike Clarke, he manages to pull the suspect over for questioning, but they are surprised when they discover the truth behind the cloned plates

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: Documentary following shopping centre security teams who are locked in a cat and mouse battle to catch criminals

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Animal-loving Queen guitarist Brian May helps Steve Backshall nurse convalescing bats, while The Yorkshire Vet's Julian Norton investigates some of the UK's more exotic inhabitants

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor recounts the history of Winchester Cathedral, the longest medieval cathedral in northern Europe, which has witnessed civil wars, religious battles and struggled with collapsing foundations. It is the burial place of novelist Jane Austen - though only four people attended her funeral and originally her plaque made no mention of her writing. Tony learns that Winchester's bishops were among the richest, most influential and most badly behaved in the country and some were wealthier and more powerful than even England's kings

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers her advice on making first impressions really count, visiting a couple in East Sussex who are desperate to sell their unappealing Bournemouth home and move to Australia

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet visits the Met Office to find out where rain comes from, while the Milkshakers! show him how to make a rain collector

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Halloween arrives in Adventure Bay - but a mysterious kid in a giant spider costume is taking all the treats from the trick-or-treaters

programme.title: Getting Personal
programme.desc: Lucindha Lawson discusses how football and futsal have been constants amidst the struggles in her life and how she has achieved her dreams

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: Carry On Cabby (1963)
programme.desc: The neglected wife of a workaholic taxi owner grows increasingly tired of his lack of interest in their marriage. In a ploy to bring him to his senses, she secretly launches a rival cab firm with a driver roster made up of attractive women, who soon tempt his customers away. Comedy, starring Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Kenneth Connor and Charles Hawtrey

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express (1965)
programme.desc: A courageous American colonel with a never-say-die attitude is held in a PoW camp. He boldly sets out to lead a group of Allied prisoners in a daring mass escape bid by hijacking a freight train and fleeing through occupied Italy to Switzerland. Second World War action adventure, starring Frank Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Brad Dexter and James Brolin

programme.title: Finding Your Feet (2017)
programme.desc: A wealthy woman's privileged existence is shattered when she discovers her husband is having an affair with her best friend. Seeking solace, she turns to her estranged sister, who lives in a London council estate, and finds a new lease of life in joining her community dance class. Comedy, starring Imelda Staunton, Celia Imrie, Timothy Spall and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Flight (2012)
programme.desc: An airline pilot with a history of heavy drinking and drug use successfully lands a plane that suffers mechanical problems during a fierce storm, saving the lives of nearly everyone on board. While initially hailed as a hero, it later emerges that he was drunk at the time, raising questions about whether he may have contributed to the disaster rather than averted it. Drama, starring Denzel Washington and Don Cheadle

programme.title: Fences (2016)
programme.desc: Adaptation of the August Wilson play about a working-class African-American dad trying to raise his family in the 1950s, while coming to terms with the events of his life. Directed by and starring Denzel Washington, with an Oscar-winning Viola Davis

programme.title: The Fits (2015)
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Toni becomes entranced with a tight-knit dance team in Cincinnati's West End. Enamoured by the power and confidence of this strong community of girls, she eagerly absorbs routines, masters drills and even pierces her own ears to fit in. A mysterious outbreak of fainting spells plagues the team, and Toni finds herself caught up in danger as her desire for acceptance is twisted. Drama, starring Royalty Hightower and Alexis Neblett

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: It Should Happen to You (1954)
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: The Last Hurrah (1958)
programme.desc: John Ford's political drama, starring Spencer Tracy as a headstrong New England mayor who launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and that he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker (Basil Rathbone). Also starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pat O'Brien

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite (2004)
programme.desc: A socially inept high-school student and his lonely unemployed brother find their eccentric home life thrown into upheaval when their meddling uncle comes to stay. The teenage oddball tries to make the best of his changing circumstances, while putting all his skills to the task of helping his new best friend win the class presidency. Comedy, starring Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez and Haylie Duff

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Tyrannosaur (2011)
programme.desc: An alcoholic unable to control his violent temper is struck when a charity shop worker responds to his verbal abuse with forgiveness. As they become friends, he learns she is trapped in an abusive marriage and takes her in when she runs away. However, his destructive urges continue to plague him. Drama written and directed by Paddy Considine, starring Peter Mullan, Olivia Colman and Eddie Marsan

programme.title: Journeyman (2017)
programme.desc: World middleweight champion Matty Burton is nearing the end of his professional career when he suffers a serious head injury during a fight that leaves him with brain damage. Boxing drama, written, directed by and starring Paddy Considine, with Jodie Whittaker, Paul Popplewell and Tony Pitts

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: The Far Country (1954)
programme.desc: A cowpoke is steering his cattle north to the Canadian border when a corrupt sheriff commandeers the herd. A local saloon-bar owner falls for the hapless cowboy, and with her help he recaptures his cattle. Hooking up with a wagon train, the couple head for the mining town of Dawson, but the thwarted and embittered sheriff is on their tail. Western, with James Stewart, Walter Brennan and Ruth Roman

programme.title: Father Goose (1964)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking beachcomber languishing on a small South Sea island is dragooned by the Australian Navy into looking out for Japanese spy-planes during the Second World War. When his path crosses with a teacher and her schoolgirl pupils marooned on a nearby shore, he pilots them to the safety of his own home. Predictably, the prim schoolmistress and her drunkard host make for poor company. Comedy, with Cary Grant, Leslie Caron and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The Swimmer (1968)
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by swimming in the neighbourhood pools along the way. Director Frank Perry's cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3 (2017)
programme.desc: Following their win at the world championship, the now-separated Bellas (an all-female a cappella singing group) reunite for one last singing competition at an overseas USO tour. However, they face a squad who uses both instruments and voices. Final part of the blockbusting comedy trilogy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends (2019)
programme.desc: Ten fishermen from Cornwall are signed by a record label and pursue a top ten hit with their debut album, 'Sea Shanties'. Comedy, starring James Purefoy, Meadow Nobrega, David Hayman, Maggie Steed and Sam Swainsbury

programme.title: Hancock (2008)
programme.desc: A reluctant, alcoholic superhero ends up the most hated man in Los Angeles thanks to his habit of causing mayhem and destruction while trying to do good. However, when he saves the life of a PR guru, the grateful executive sets about transforming the public perception of the crime-fighter, despite his wife's strong misgivings. Comedy, starring Will Smith, Jason Bateman and Charlize Theron

programme.title: Patti Cake$ (2017)
programme.desc: Aspiring rapper Patricia Dombrowski lives a dead-end day in a dead-end New Jersey town. However, she is determined not to let life keep her down as she, her best friend Jheri and a growing band of misfits look to make their hip-hop dreams come true. Drama, starring Danielle Macdonald, Sahr Ngaujah and Bridget Everett

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie tries to give Hunter's love life a push in the direction of Zoe, Lucas causes trouble, and Sienna tells Ethan she thinks Rafe might be close to proposing

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter tries to tell Freya their relationship is strictly student and teacher. Sienna questions Ethan on his whereabouts when he fails to return home

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to reverse the fortunes of the Mixing Bowl diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner Peter Matthews, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake and Charles take Terry on a camping trip to help him deal with stress. Amy gets Gina to help her persuade the police department to buy a product she invented as a child. Holt helps Rosa to break up with Marcus. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake and Amy work together on a case, but wind up arguing over Jake's old, worn-out mattress. Meanwhile, Boyle scratches Holt's prized car, and the teenage boy Rosa sponsors as a 'big brother' is in trouble with the law. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls' trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj try to find out whether they could survive a dark matter research expedition in a salt mine by attempting to simulate the conditions in a steam tunnel beneath the university. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are sent into a panic when a loud, obnoxious couple come to look at the house next door. Jay is furious to learn that Manny is dating the granddaughter of his biggest business rival, while Mitch and Cam take on Lily's tyrannical teacher, Mrs Plank. Steve Zahn and Andrea Anders join the cast as new neighbours Ronnie and Amber, with guest star Tyne Daly

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween is Claire's favourite holiday, but this year she is snowed under at work, so she allows Phil to take over the house-decorating duties - a decision she soon comes to regret. Jay isn't too happy with the Shrek costume Gloria picked out for him so makes a last-minute change, and soon becomes attached to his new outfit, while Mitch's attempt to escape from a work slump hits a stumbling block

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy drive themselves to distraction trying to figure out what the 'perfect gift' is that Leonard and Penny have got them for their wedding. Meanwhile, Raj decides he wants to settle down and asks his father to arrange a marriage for him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard and Bernadette's life becomes complicated when Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home. Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family, and Raj further explores the possibility of an arranged marriage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard receives shocking news as everyone prepares for the re-opening of the comic-book store. Penny tries to teach Sheldon how to 'let it go', but she is unable to follow her own advice when she learns something infuriating about Amy. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Fillion, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny agree to participate in an unusual experiment, and Leonard, Amy, Raj and Emily spend the evening trying to escape from a 'zombie'. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette run into trouble at the airport after returning from Mrs Wolowitz's funeral. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When her usual stylist isn't available, Gemma decides to use Tina's hairdresser for an important work event, while Malcolm discovers a connection with his new professor

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Marty are surprised when their new business sparks protests from residents who are concerned about gentrification, while Grover's family tree project reveals fresh details about the whereabouts of Dave's estranged father, who left when he was a child.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are flying home from a weekend away, but Phil is less than happy when Claire takes the only first-class seat available. Mitch and Cam throw a belated baby shower for their friend Sal, and are surprised to find that motherhood seems to have changed her, and Jay shows Manny how to defend himself against a bully in his cooking class. Elizabeth Banks, Nathan Lane and Penn Jillette guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is stuck at an airport and needs to track down Haley, who has gone missing following an argument, so she logs on to her laptop and checks in with the rest of the family in the hope of making amends with her daughter. Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta offers a drug case to Scully and Hitchcock because he wants to work on a case with Boyle that Holt says involves a celebrity, while Amy and Gina learn that Rosa never attends blood-donation drives because she is afraid of needles

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct gets a new detective who is coming away from a 12-year undercover assignment with the Mob. Boyle's latest mess lands everyone in trouble with the caretakers, and Gina directs a video about the precinct for Captain Holt. Jason Mantzoukas and Kate Flannery guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is upset after Lucy runs away in the middle of their date, leaving the gang to cheer him up. However, when Howard bumps into her, she admits she is incredibly shy. Meanwhile, Sheldon asks Penny to help with a new episode of Fun with Flags, and because he is impressed by her acting ability, the friends go to see her in a performance of A Streetcar Named Desire

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While the girls go to Disneyland and get made up as princesses, the guys have to promote science as a career option for women at Howard's old middle school. Meanwhile, Raj and Lucy have their first date in a library, where instead of speaking to each other they send text messages

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct by two physicists from Chicago - until the experts try to exclude Amy from their Nobel Prize nomination. Bernadette experiences a big success at work and plans for Penny to become a part of it - whether she wants to or not

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is excited to help Howard and Bernadette navigate some bureaucratic paperwork, until he discovers that they are breaking the law, leaving him with a difficult choice between following the rules or staying loyal to his friends. Leonard is disappointed when he is excluded from a scientific project his friends are working on

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet newlyweds Nikki and Andy Taylor-Myers in Northampton, who have recently merged households and are unhappy in their cluttered terrace. Property services manager Andy is desperate to stay in their home, but drama and support teacher Nikki has reached boiling point and wants a fresh start

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Visayan warty pig Wendy is fed up with the attentions of male pig Jake and decides to escape. Meanwhile, young giraffe Narus has been battling with other young males in the herd, so the keepers decide the time has come to move him to a new zoo. Which is easier said than done

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Poodle cross Wally is struggling to find a forever home, having spent a year in the centre during which time he has had four unsuccessful attempts. But the staff remain confident someone will come along who is able to handle his tricky behaviour. Meanwhile, bichon frise Bruce is looking for a quiet home and a comfy lap. Will he find that with Janet from Sheffield, who wants a well-behaved dog to keep her company after the death of her husband?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2003 Gil and Hillary Briffa decided to retire to southern Spain, where they planned to build a contemporary home in the Andalusian hills against the backdrop of more traditional properties. A few years later, Gil died, but now Kevin McCloud revisits Hillary to find out whether her residence has settled into its landscape and how life is treating her as a British widow living abroad

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix explores Burgundy with chef Michael Caines, visiting a a rustic restaurant deep in the wooded countryside of the Ouche Valley with a phenomenal farm-to-fork experience. Michael also returns to the restaurant where he was tutored as a young chef, while in Beaune, they sample some of the finest pastry available anywhere in France

programme.title: 9/11: The Falling Man
programme.desc: Documentary about the people who jumped from the World Trade Centre during the September 11 terrorist attacks, and one man in particular whose plight was one of the defining images of the tragedy. Contributors include the photographer who captured the shot, which was published in newspapers before being banned, and the journalist who claimed to have identified the falling man

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In this compilation, the medics race to help out at some serious home emergencies, including a man who has been crushed by a collapsed wall

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Linden, 15, is brought to A&E having badly cut his leg while back-flipping off a shed roof onto a trampoline. As well as calling an ambulance, his friends filmed the accident on their mobile phones and happily show the clip to the staff at King's. Junior doctor Sammy looks after 88-year-old Panayiota, who has been referred to hospital with breathing difficulties. Originally from Cyprus, the patient speaks very little English and Sammy has to contact a translator to help with the diagnosis and treatment. Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has taken an overdose of tablets and is refusing to go to hospital, while a six-year-old girl suffers a seizure in a school playground

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Linden, 15, is brought to A&E having badly cut his leg while back-flipping off a shed roof onto a trampoline. As well as calling an ambulance, his friends filmed the accident on their mobile phones and happily show the clip to the staff at King's. Junior doctor Sammy looks after 88-year-old Panayiota, who has been referred to hospital with breathing difficulties. Originally from Cyprus, the patient speaks very little English and Sammy has to contact a translator to help with the diagnosis and treatment. Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Angellica Bell make stylish braided coasters, and presenter Amanda Lamb faces actress Debra Stephenson in the timed challenge, where they have 30 minutes to create personalised embossed greeting cards

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps John, a widower from County Durham, search for a new property in rural, inland Malaga in Spain, with a budget of ¬£140,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A restaurant in the Algarve finally opens its doors, and a pony trekking business in Italy hangs in the balance after receiving a visit from an army of vets

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners, turning items into hard cash. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this edition

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the relatives of a south London woman, but they are misled by a trail of dubious clues and are left questioning their knowledge. Meanwhile, research into family trees reveals the lives of British soldiers in 19th-century India

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Wisteria House, Hampshire, where owner Jane Faulkner invites guests to her establishment. Later, the group members try their hands at milking a cow, while 25-year-old Zak causes surprises when he reveals his years of hospitality experience

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit The Living Room B&B in Bournemouth on their second night, which is co-owned by 25-year-old Zak Busby-Pelekanou. While at the establishment, Mike and Charlie have a hairy issue, and Jane and Amy encounter a spider, before getting to grips with an ambitious breakfast menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Valley Hotel in Anglesey, where owner Mike Lewis hopes his five-star pedigree will help him reap dividends in the competition. After a visit to a local RNLI station, guests Jane and Amy are left feeling sluggish when they spot an unwanted visitor in their room, and their criticism leaves the hosts looking for answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David and Elvira Barratt welcome the contestants to Barratt's at Ty'n Rhyl, Denbighshire, but the group has an unpleasant experience on arrival. The guests take part in an activity at a local cookery school where they are taught the art of preparing and cooking sheep's testicles. However, come feedback time, the hosts are left feeling distraught

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet to find out who earned the most and have it out with their rivals. Jane and Amy kick off proceedings with a gripe over David and Elvira's coffee criticism, yet are confronted themselves by Zak, who has a score to settle. Mike and Charlie of the Valley Hotel want to get to the bottom of an unwanted intruder during their stay at Wisteria House, and the ladies are challenged again regarding their cleanliness comments. Emotions run high as the cash is counted and the winner is revealed

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Larne in Northern Ireland with Catherine and Nigel Finch, who have been married for seven years, but lately have hit a spot of turbulence due to their dated, 1970s-style bungalow. Nigel quickly fell for their rural location's incredible views, but Catherine has never loved the place and misses having neighbours, so Phil searches for a home that pleases them both, offering room for Nigel's beloved chickens, while giving Catherine more people around her

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly cheetah Matrah is ostracised by his brothers Burba and Singha when he starts to show signs of a leg injury. Cameras also follow Chester Zoo's Sumatran orangutans, including adolescent female Tuti and four-month-old Kesuma. And there's also a look at Asian pond turtle Shrek, whose love life proved fatal for a previous mate

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Collie cross puppy Joey is a popular dog around the kennels, and has been a reliable buddy for the anxious dogs - but will he prove the same support to Holly, Adam and their son Oscar? Toy poodle Gizmo tries to overcome his social anxieties to win the hearts of Fiona and Maisie, a mother and daughter coming to terms with their future separation, and a lurcher with a broken tail requires lots of care - and with any luck, a forever home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a memorable restoration project in the remote Creuse region of central France. Back in 2003, when Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs gave up everything in the UK to start a new life abroad, they couldn't have known what was ahead of them. Falling in love with a dilapidated manor house with just four crumbling walls and half a roof, they embarked on a mission to transform it - working day and night, doing everything themselves, year after year - until slowly but surely they created a magnificent edifice out of the ruins they bought off the internet. On the 70th anniversary of the destruction of the original 19th-century building by the German army, the house finally took its finished form

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: It's a busy Mother's Day at south London's King's College Hospital as 23-year-old builder Jamie is rushed in by paramedics having fallen from the roof of a three-storey building, landing on a brick wall. The team performs an emergency ultrasound to determine whether he has suffered internal injuries or fractured his ribs and spine, and spot a punctured lung that needs to be reinflated. Four-month-old Weston has been brought to paediatric A&E after suffering from diarrhoea and vomiting for more than 24 hours, while doctors suspect David, 74, has had a stroke. Junior doctor Matt looks after 80-year-old Daphne, who has dislocated her replacement hip

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: A trauma team from Aberdeen rush to an amateur pilot who has crashed his vintage plane in Elgin on the outskirts of Moray, sustaining multiple injuries. A man is crushed underneath a dumper truck at a farm in rural Dumfriesshire, while in Glasgow, a distressing call comes in about a 12-year-old girl knocked down and dragged under a car

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark assembles a crack team to save a man with life-threatening gunshot wounds. Dr Jonathan suspects that a surfing coach who's been in a horror crash has a shattered leg

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The trauma team at St George's Hospital in south-west London fights to save the life of a young woman involved in a motorbike accident, which has completely severed her right leg below the knee. An 11-year-old boy is brought in after having a prolonged epileptic seizure, and a 19-year-old arrives with a sewing needle stuck in her foot, but she seems more keen on taking advice from her mum in Bulgaria than from the doctor

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics attend a suspected domestic assault and need to treat one man who claims he was punched and knocked unconscious. A rare genetic disease leaves a woman with a dislocated shoulder and in excruciating pain, and a man, who in the past has threatened the emergency services with a weapon, calls for an ambulance

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Four-month-old Weston has been brought to paediatric A&E after suffering from diarrhoea and vomiting for more than 24 hours, while doctors suspect David, 74, has had a stroke. Junior doctor Matt looks after 80-year-old Daphne, who has dislocated her replacement hip

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dave and Debbie Chambers from Redditch, Worcestershire, started their family young, but now their four children have grown up, they've decided to recapture their youth and buy a place in Spain where they can enjoy time in the sun - just the two of them. For their budget of ¬£45,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments in and around the town of Torrevieja, but will any of them be their perfect place?

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Nurse Karen and GP Alastair from Montrose long for a slower pace of life and are relocating to the beautiful countryside of the Dordogne in France. They want a character property with a pool, that's also big enough for their whole family to come and visit. Laura Hamilton shows them five options for their ¬£175,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: An escaped horse causes mayhem at an Italian B&B. Elsewhere in France, a British couple reopen their guesthouse after months of enforced lockdown

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including stained glass and a Victorian hay rack that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items, and their latest find is an old bureau which gets a makeover in Yorkshire

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Teacher Jeffrey Hancock always kept in touch with his relatives, but when the team takes on his case, the pressure is on to track them down. Meanwhile, research into family trees uncovers secret liaisons and the challenges of life as part of the Women's Royal Naval Service, before details of unclaimed estates are disclosed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Who'd a Thought It in Grafty Green, Kent, where partners Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin hope to impress their fellow guests. On arrival, Liz and Brian are excited over their two hot tubs, and Jackie and Paul are more than happy with the complimentary champagne. However, Matthew and Liam are underwhelmed by the cleanliness levels

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the New Osborne Hotel in Blackpool on their second night, where proprietor Matthew Bracegirdle and entertainment manager Liam hope their guests feel at home in their family friendly establishment. However, Jackie and Paul are unimpressed by their small room, and Joe and Alex find the cleanliness levels lacking

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Fairy Falls Hotel in Trefriw, Conwy County Borough, where B&B newcomers Jackie and Paul Langshaw hope to impress the other contestants. They take their guests to a local maze in the afternoon and, after an uncomfortable night's sleep for Alex, some of the breakfast orders are misplaced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Husband and wife Liz and Brian Jardine welcome their guests to The Great Trewern B&B, Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where they enjoy the quiet life. Joe and Alex feel far away from it all, but the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress the other guests. At dinner, talk turns to first impressions and it appears it is all water under the bridge for Jackie and Joe, but she remains upset with the feedback Matthew and Liam gave her

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one final time to find out what they have been paid. Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin kick things off by confronting Matthew Bracegirdle and Liam Halewood about their comments regarding the cleanliness of their establishment, and Jackie and Paul Langshaw complain about their poor breakfast score

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Amber and Martin Brammah in Waterbeach, Cambridgeshire, who are undecided on whether they should sell their home or completely renovate it. Amber owns a fitness company and runs classes from home, and feels a bigger property would be better for her business. However, Martin feels that it would be better to use their budget to renovate their current family home

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers introduce some new, young males to Bertha, the South American blue poison dart frog that loves to wrestle, in the hope that one of them will be strong enough to win her over. A new mandrill monkey named Kamau arrives at the zoo to be introduced to the group, but the keepers are worried that his lack of experience with females might be a problem

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. Nine-week-old French bulldog Kevin competes with a nervous terrier to win the hearts of loved-up couple Ryan and Katie, while a recently widowed grandmother seeks another 'beating heart' to help fill a home that is feeling very empty

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicky Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent ¬£1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.title: The Duchess and Her Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: While the Lilidorei project is on hold due to planning permission delays, the Duchess stays busy with a packed schedule of events over the winter season. The Duchess plants 11 stuffed dogs around the premises to feel more at home at Alnwick Castle and prepares for the arrival of her pet rats. Head butler Jan has his work cut out for him as the staff prepare for a high-profile state dinner and battle against storm Arwen to decorate the 16ft Christmas tree

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: From medieval to modern times, British monarchs have always been at the centre of scandals. Professor Suzannah Lipscomb looks at the roles the press, parliament and public have played over the centuries in generating outrage and spreading rumours. Dr Joanne Paul, Professor Matthew McCormack and Dr Anna Senkiw help Suzannah investigate some of the most notorious cold cases involving royals from the past, here focusing on suspicious deaths

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This edition focuses on the treatment of sport enthusiasts who have had accidents on two wheels. Teacher Dave, 53, has facial injuries after riding his new bicycle into the back of a stationary car in Richmond Park, while 30-year-old adrenaline junkie and former Royal Marine Richard has badly dislocated his thumb after falling off a bike

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?

programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food takes a gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France, from Bordeaux to Marseille. He samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as exploring a variety of traditional recipes, including artichoke salad with poached egg, eels in cider, and bass with beurre blanc

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food explores the banks of the River Garonne on board a 100-year-old converted barge, and savours the delights of French provincial cooking including magret de canard and petit sale. Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire is nearing its end as he leaves southern Greece for the shores of western Turkey. On the Cesme Peninsula Rick enjoys creamy Armola cheese matured in goat skins, Urla's famous red wine and the ultimate Turkish breakfast. He also cooks the country's iconic dish sultan's delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree

programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness get to grips with a disused hearse, and give it a new lease of life as the ultimate family car. On the track, Chris puts the Dallara Stradale through its paces, while royal couple Zara and Mike Tindall go head-to-head in Star in a Reasonably Fast Car

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge excursion through south-west France, visiting the city of Agen and tasting the first melon of the season in Quercy before cooking the famous Gascon dish poule au pot

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip reaches a conclusion as he arrives in Istanbul, just in time for the bluefish season, which allows him the chance to enjoy a fishing expedition on the Bosphorus, one of the world's most strategic waterways, which divides the city into two continents. Rick also cooks two much-loved local dishes - lavish kofte kebabs with pistachios, and kapuska, a hearty traditional Turkish cuisine stew from the Black Sea region, whose name is derived from the Russian word for cabbage

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Poland. He begins in the capital Warsaw, where he takes to the floor to dance to one of Chopin's polonaises with high-school students rehearsing for their leavers' ball, before discovering how the former industrial city of Lodz supplied the vast Russian empire of the early 20th century. He then heads to Poznan and rides one of the few remaining steam-powered commuter trains, visits a factory in Wroclaw that manufactures car bodies for locomotives, and ends his journey in Krakow, where he takes a tour in an iconic vehicle of the communist era

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

One guest brings in a painting that is a reminder of an uncomfortable family secret

At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. programme.desc: George Clarke helps more people make their period homes fit for modern life. On a cobbled street in Cheshire sits a Georgian town house that could be straight out of a Dickens novel. The staff rally round when receptionist Glenda Purdie is diagnosed with cancer, and reception manager Alison agrees to have her head shorn for charity

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red

Jay also has burns on his hands and knees. Dr Katie White and critical care paramedic Karen Baker are immediately dispatched

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a lance corporal, whose body has been found in an empty house, and discovers he had a number of spurned lovers and a $2million inheritance. Ducky and Gibbs interview one of the dead marine's partners, but disagree over whether she is telling the truth. David McCallum and Mark Harmon star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Kidnappers strike on Halloween, wounding a marine sergeant and snatching his daughter - leaving the team members wondering why anyone would try to extort money from someone on such a modest salary. As the agents begin searching for a motive, Abby surprises everyone by turning up at the lab in a revealing fancy-dress costume

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team joins forces with military investigators to ascertain whether terrorists were responsible for an explosion at a golf course in which a marine colonel was killed. As inquiries proceed, McGee has to use his computer skills to break into secret government files to ensure the murderers are apprehended. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The suspicious death of a rich Iranian caviar importer the day after his wedding leads the detectives to a string of suspects, including his wife and his chief competitor in the industry. However, new light is thrown on the investigation by the discovery that the murder weapon was a pillow belonging to the businessman's daughter

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Jerry Orbach's final appearance in the crime drama. Briscoe's investigation into the killing of a delivery man uncovers the married victim's involvement in a website arranging romantic liaisons between consenting adults, and reveals the deceased's wife had recently purchased a gun

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The conviction of a death row prisoner is called into question by the revelation that attorney-client privilege may have prompted a former prosecutor to withhold evidence capable of establishing his innocence. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Fontana and Green are baffled by a series of flu-related deaths until they discover the victims were given bogus vaccines. McCoy sets out to prosecute the man responsible for their distribution, but a mistake by new ADA Alexandra Borgia threatens their case and leaves the rookie at odds with her boss

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A controversial talk show host is shot dead in the street and suspicion initially falls on a woman who was suing him for sexual harassment. However, later evidence leads the team to the victim's wife, who stands to inherit $20million, and a stalker who claims to be having an affair with her. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Borgia prosecute a famous basketball player accused of murdering a fan who had been harassing him for some time. They discover the star's fingerprints in the victim's apartment, but the evidence linking him to the crime scene is dismissed as inadmissible because the detectives cut corners to find a match on the police database. Starring Sam Waterston and Annie Parisse

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Jenny Shepard tries to solve the murder of an underworld source who was prepared to give information on the activities of arms dealer La Grenouille. Unfortunately her behaviour becomes increasingly obsessive as the case proceeds, leaving Gibbs wondering if her judgement is being clouded by a personal motivation. Starring Lauren Holly and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A blind man unwittingly photographs evidence of a murder, leading Jethro and the team to the corpse of a petty officer who was stabbed with a knife left at the scene. Further evidence indicates his death was not the result of a random mugging - but cracking the case proves difficult. Meanwhile, Tony has relationship problems. Drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is made acting director while Jenny is attending an overseas conference. However, he decides to ignore his duties and investigate the murder of a man who arrived dead in a taxi at the team's headquarters with no clues to his identity - except a mysterious list of names. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: A tragedy buried in Mossad agent Samar's past is brought to light as the task force hunt down a terrorist. Tom runs into major difficulties in his plan to clear Liz's name

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Kat crosses the line when she follows up on her suspicions about a trainer at her boxing gym. Crime drama, starring Abby Royle and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins tries to find a government worker who is withholding green cards in exchange for sex. Crime drama, starring Kelli Giddish and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on board a US Navy hospital ship after being shot. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and Joanna Teague head for Shanghai, where they hope to take down the leaders of the terrorist group known as The Calling. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Mimi Rogers

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs throws himself back into his work following his near-death experience, updating his appearance and tackling a new risky case alongside DEA agent Luis Mitchell, who wants help bringing down a drugs cartel. Concerned about his colleague's apparent enthusiasm to re-enter the field, DiNozzo discovers Mitchell is the son of a former NCIS agent who gave his life trying to save Gibbs' late wife and daughter, and this attachment is causing Gibbs to break his own rule against personal involvement in a case. However, a significant danger is posed by Benson Long, the cartel's head, and Mitchell's top target

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the murder of a family of four in their own home, and are led to a pair of suspects who have questionable mental states. Crime drama, starring Jeremy Sisto and Anthony Anderson

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate when a model who gatecrashed the mayor's black-tie party is found dead in an alley. The victim's brother becomes a prime suspect before the detectives discover links between the girl and a New York senator who was also at the event

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces out on the road and in the air to discover how CCTV and technological advances are being used to fight crime. Footage includes some residents taking neighbourhood watch to the next level, a group of thugs caught wrongdoing on a housing estate and a pensioner using her walking stick to defend herself against an intruder

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former marine falls to his death from a hotel balcony, and investigations quickly lead to the discovery of another body. As Gibbs and the team dig deeper, they uncover evidence that points to the activities of a vice ring trafficking young girls. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee tries to help his sister, who believes she may have murdered someone - but is too traumatised and disorientated to remember exactly what happened. As the team investigates the connected case of a sailor's death, Tony and Abby find themselves distracted by relationship problems. Drama, starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Two FBI agents try to seize control of the team's investigation into the discovery of a perfectly preserved body hidden in a chimney at a marine base. Reluctant to be ousted from the case, Gibbs agrees to work with them - and learns the victim was a serial killer responsible for the deaths of 14 people. Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is accused of murdering her husband's mistress. Although the crime is found to be premeditated, the defendant's lawyer claims his client's actions were prompted by post-traumatic stress syndrome arising from the September 11 terrorist attack. Starring Dennis Farina

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A recently paroled prison gang member is shot dead, and suspicion falls on former crime associates - until his battle behind bars with a corrections officer comes to light. McCoy then learns the defence attorney will claim his client took action to ward off a threat by the con and his 'brotherhood'. Guest starring Candice Bergen

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy discovers two suicide victims were participating in clinical trials of an experimental antidepressant, prompting him to charge the drug company's CEO with second-degree murder. In court the defence argues all medical research carries an element of risk and the judge rules prosecution evidence inadmissible, leaving the outcome on a knife-edge. Sam Waterston and Dennis Farina star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A car chase through Manhattan leaves one man dead and a teenager injured, leading Fontana and Green to discover the victim was being followed after massacring a hunting party. As the man who led the chase is publicly lauded for his brave efforts, McCoy and Borgia make their case that his poor decisions only endangered other lives. Starring Sam Waterston and Annie Parisse

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A celebrity chef is suspected of murdering his lover, a TV network executive who had antagonised him by deciding to cancel his cookery show. The case eventually goes to court, but a juror is accused of trying to profit from the trial. Drama, starring Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An ambitious lawyer is murdered in her office and evidence points to one of her colleagues, who was present at the scene. However, a further crime later takes place, prompting McCoy to shift the focus to a senior partner at the law firm who provided the suspect with an alibi. Guest starring Fritz Weaver, with Sam Waterston

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs tries to find out why the agents are being forced by Homeland Security to take polygraph tests, while Tony and Jeanne are held hostage by a drug dealer. Elsewhere, Jenny returns from Europe to discover she has had a surprise visitor. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the hunt for La Grenouille intensifies, Tony's cover is blown and his car is later destroyed in an explosion, leaving the team convinced he has been killed. However, Ducky's autopsy on the body of the driver reveals it was actually someone else who died in the blast

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to the scene of a car accident in which a petty officer was killed. They discover a bullet wound in the body, as well as another victim at the bottom of a nearby ravine - a woman who was beaten to death. Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The New York police drama returns for its tenth and final series. A woman is found shot dead two days after attending a party thrown by fashion designer Nyle Brite. A search of her home uncovers a large selection of wigs, condoms and clothes by the designer, plus a number of nasty text messages on her phone, leading the team to wonder whether she moonlighted as a high-class prostitute. Crime drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A popular CEO claims that she has been raped, but her business partner insists that she is lying. Crime drama, starring Kelli Giddish and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins' sister stirs up tension when she reports a doctor who trades prescription painkillers for sexual favours. Crime drama, starring Kelli Giddish and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine is found murdered in Quantico, mere hours after calling Gibbs to discuss a possible case. In response, Bishop and McGee go undercover as a married couple to run surveillance on a lieutenant and his wife, who may be connected to the death. Starring Mark Harmon, Emily Wickersham and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A young Navy Seaman is found dead, with his eyes gouged out, after being involved in a car accident. Director Vance makes a rare return to field duty, pairing up with Gibbs to investigate when it becomes clear the killing seems to be connected to the case of Kip Klugman, a former NCIS agent he once locked up for stealing evidence. Starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Judge Gary Feldman discovers that McCoy and Ross have indicted an innocent man on charges of rape following an attack on a girl in Harlem. As her life hangs by a thread, the mistake sparks departmental scandal and looks set to ruin Schiff's political career. Jerry Orbach, Sam Waterston and Carey Lowell star

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to find out who was responsible for sabotaging a robotic vehicle that caused the death of a Navy lieutenant and almost killed Abby. Meanwhile, Ziva's suspicions are aroused by the discovery that Tony is repeatedly visiting the hospital. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Michael Weatherly, Cote de Pablo and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. Although the town's authorities have allegedly already investigated the crime, Gibbs is determined to conduct his own thorough inquiries - which may lead him to a terrorist cell. Drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green goes undercover to gather evidence on gun dealers who murdered two detectives during a firearms sting, and McCoy tries to prove a fellow attorney paid the killers to avenge the death of his stepson, who was shot dead in a police operation several years earlier. Crime drama, starring Jesse L Martin and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous novelist dies after undergoing plastic surgery, leading to the discovery that her surgeon made a crucial mistake by prescribing a drug that should not have been mixed with the antidepressants she was already taking. McCoy suggests the next of kin prosecute in a civil case, but Southerlyn disagrees and hunts for further evidence of malpractice

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The Governor of Connecticut's wife is murdered at a Republican Party function and the investigation leads police to uncover a gay love triangle involving her husband. An arrest is soon made, but a key witness is barred from testifying at the trial because he has entered into a civil partnership with the killer

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murders of a porn star and a maverick publisher lead Fontana and his new partner Falco (The Sopranos' Michael Imperioli) to a powerful police commissioner who is expecting a promotion. DA Branch warns McCoy to tread carefully with the high-profile suspect - especially when an intimate link comes to light. Starring Dennis Farina and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jockey is shot dead, leading Fontana and Falco into the murkier side of horse racing, where they discover the victim's prized thoroughbred was bought by a corporate boss using embezzled funds. McCoy takes control in court, but a witness's emotional outburst and the defendant's disappearance put the case in jeopardy. Starring Dennis Farina, Michael Imperioli and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Fontana and Falco discover a charred pistol after arresting an arsonist, which leads them to reinvestigate an unsolved murder. Their remorseful prime suspect offers a confession, hoping his new-found religious faith and charity work will benefit his case as public support builds for him

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While performing an autopsy for a class of military students, Ducky discovers the cadaver he is using is the body of a murder victim. In trying to identify the corpse, Gibbs and his team are set on the trail of a career criminal specialising in identity fraud. Meanwhile, Ziva has difficulty separating her personal feelings and professional judgment. Starring David McCallum and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy Seal is shot dead while threatening to throw himself from the top of a building. An al-Qaeda operative emerges as the main suspect, but DiNozzo thinks the killer may actually be found closer to home. Elsewhere, a rumour spreads that Abby may be about to leave NCIS for good. Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star in the American drama

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU heads to Oregon to investigate a series of gothic, ritualistic murders, with assistance from a local detective and a psychiatric patient. Guest starring Robert Englund (A Nightmare on Elm Street)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A ballerina is shocked to discover she has been secretly videotaped for a pornographic website. Crime drama, starring Kelli Giddish and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Chief Garland is conflicted when a pastor at his church is arrested, which forces him to put friendship aside. Crime drama, starring Kelli Giddish and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby visits a pharmaceutical lab to investigate a murder case, but when armed men storm the facility and hold everyone hostage, she is trapped within the building with no means of communicating with the outside world. Crime drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The notorious Tri-State Sniper appears to have claimed another victim when a petty officer is shot dead in a crowded park. However, when the team discovers the killer in question was already in custody on the day of the shooting, it becomes clear a copy-cat is on the loose. As their investigation progresses, the agents learn the victim was recently found guilty of placing a camera in the female changing rooms of the USS Camden, earning himself plenty of enemies - but did any of them hate him enough to kill?

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to investigate the murder of a retired US Navy lieutenant commander, and the inquiry forces Ducky to reveal he has been working as part of a secret society dedicated to solving cold cases. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo is reunited with his old flame, Jeanne Benoit, when insurgents in Sudan attack a group of volunteer doctors, including her husband. Travelling to the crime scene to conduct a joint murder-kidnapping investigation, Dinozzi and McGee offer their assistance in searching for the missing doctors. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray, with Scottie Thompson
