programme.desc: Officer Forester races to save the life of a critically ill cat, Lieutenant Scott tracks down a dog that ran away following an explosion and the team tries to rescue 77 collies

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A teenage paddleboarder is being swept out to sea off the coast of north Wales, so the crew of the Abersoch lifeboat race to reach him before he is lost for ever. The crew of the Lizard lifeboat station face two missions, as they are called out to a cargo ship taking on water and in danger of sinking with its crew still on board, followed by a small yacht being battered by a storm in the Atlantic

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle clears a pensioner's home and uncovers a haul of valuable silver. Later in Elgin in Scotland, she finds a collection of Paddington Bears

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Charlie Ross and James Braxton are halfway through their trip, travelling from Shenton in Leicestershire before heading auction in Bourne End, Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Charlie Ross and James Braxton head from Northamptonshire to Buckinghamshire, before seeing how much their lots bring under the hammer in St Albans, Hertfordshire

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress with Tan France
programme.desc: Young bride Ellie wants Tan to find her something sexy for her big day, and Brocarde needs a modest dress to appease her ghostly groom

programme.title: 90 Day Fiance
programme.desc: Kobe is overwhelmed with emotions when he meets his son. Jibri and Miona attempt to prepare a meal for his parents, and Thais is no fan of Patrick's brother, Joh

programme.title: Ghost Hunters

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew Pritchard is impressed by historic silks once used in the royal household. Plus, in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: Money for Nothing

Furniture restyler Chloe Kempster attempts to give an old tallboy a new lease of life, while woodworker Bruce Faulseit has an interesting challenge on his hands with a collection of slate tiles. For his own project, Jay has a trio of metal lights to overhaul

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas is in Paphos in Cyprus with couple Pauline and Andy. After getting engaged on the island, the pair would now like to find their own bolthole here to share with their family for extended breaks. With the thought of one day also retiring out here, the pressure is on Scarlette to show them five top properties within their budget of ¬£80,000

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing in at almost 700lbs, 50-year-old Pauline has an addiction to food that is slowly killing her and destroying her son's life as her carer. Can she get back on track?

programme.desc: Victoria loves sparkle but doesn't want to be covered in glitter. Meanwhile, Bride Zahra craves an elaborate dress, but she will need a bigger budget

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Melissa is having a Greek wedding and doesn't want a typical dress. Meanwhile, Naomi seeks a subtly sexy frock but worries what her conservative family will think

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The return of the Bafta-winning documentary, this time following the work of the North West Ambulance Service. The staff and crews face a busy weekend dealing with 11,000 calls as 80,000 fans descend on Manchester for the annual Parklife festival. As the handlers try to prioritise the influx of calls, Andrea and Glynn are diverted from a one-year-old having a seizure to a road traffic accident on a dual carriageway. Meanwhile, Debbie and Shaun try to persuade a homeless man he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle makes a valuable find when she discovers a sketch that could be by a renowned artist. Later, a Persian rug surprises everyone on auction day

programme.desc: Auctioneers Charlie Ross and James Braxton embark on their final leg of their trek. programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Part one of two. Arthur and Merlin embark on a dangerous mission to retrieve the cup of life, a powerful artefact that carries the gift of immortality. Before they can seize the magical goblet, they are captured by corrupt slave trader Jarl, who helps the cup to find its way into Morgause's hands. Fortunately for the duo, an old friend comes to the rescue, but with the power of eternal life at the disposal of Morgana and her sister, Uther's reign may be about to end. Guest starring Ralph Ineson (The Office)

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: B'Elanna experiences painful memories regarding her identity when she learns she is expecting a child and resorts to drastic action. Roxann Dawson and Robert Duncan McNeil star

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: As a major hurricane hits the Island, Thomas and his friends find shelter inside La Mariana, along with two armed killers also escaping the storm. Plus, Rick must confess to TC that he let the insurance lapse on the bar. Guest starring Roger E Mosley, who played TC in the original series

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: The action drama returns after a break. The hunt for Andres Doza comes to a head when the team makes one last-ditch effort to find and capture the leader of one of the most powerful and lethal drug cartels in Mexico.

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Jason and Bravo Team join forces with the SAS to rescue passengers after terrorists hijack their aeroplane and take them hostage. Guest starring Louise Lombard

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: The murder of a Louisiana man forces authorities to examine every possible lead as they eventually learn their prime suspect is closely tied to an open cold case in Indiana

programme.title: Murders That Shocked The Nation
programme.desc: Fred Dinenage explores the continuing fascination with Jack the Ripper, who murdered five women in Whitechapel, London, in 1888 but was never caught

programme.title: Night Cops
programme.desc: A fight erupts at a teenager's party in Swindon, but police officers are surprised to find the mothers doing the scrapping. Cops in Darlington deal with a volatile prisoner, and a drunk with no regard for the law faces a sobering night in the cells

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The police are suspicious of a man who is wearing two pairs of trousers and two jackets, and they listen in amusement to his feeble attempts at a credible explanation. Plus, two car thieves wearing washing-up gloves make a swift getaway, but are halted when they collide with a cameraman

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: The story of a British merchant ship in an Atlantic convoy in 1940 that was left disabled and at the mercy of patrolling U-boats. The crew must keep afloat and out of harm's way

programme.desc: Desperate to kill off Grot, Reggie goes to extreme lengths, such as insulting chat show hosts on whose television shows he appears.

programme.desc: Documentary exploring cases of missing or stolen art, with the opening episode exploring a haul of previously vanished masterpieces which were originally purchased for Hitler by a German art dealer and resurfaced in Munich in 2013

programme.title: Peeping Tom (1960)
programme.desc: The son of a psychologist develops a fetish for murdering women and recording their final death throes on film, a twisted and gruesome version of his father's own voyeuristic experiments in which he recorded his son obsessively throughout every moment of his childhood. Michael Powell's psychological thriller, starring Carl Boehm, Anna Massey, Moira Shearer, Esmond Knight and Maxine Audley

programme.title: The Happy Valley (1986)
programme.desc: A teenager grows up in a society of British aristocrats in 1940s Kenya, where the colonial settlers indulge in a life of debauchery. When one resident is shot and killed, she finds herself in the difficult position of being the only one who knows what really happened - a truth many would prefer to stay buried. Fact-based period drama, starring Denholm Elliott and Holly Aird

programme.title: Killing Dad (1989)
programme.desc: A drunken, out-of-work father writes to the family he abandoned 23 years before to say he wants to come home and ask their forgiveness. His estranged son is so alarmed that he sets off in a bid to kill his unwanted deadbeat dad before he has the chance to show up. Comedy, starring Denholm Elliott, Julie Walters, Richard E Grant and Anna Massey

programme.title: Live US Open Tennis
programme.desc: Live coverage of day eight from Billie Jean King National Tennis Centre at Flushing Meadows in New York, featuring matches in the round of 16. At this stage last year the eventual winner of the Men's tournament, Carlos Alcaraz, won a five-set thriller against 11th-seed Jannik Sinner. He came from 2-1 down in sets to eventually win 3-6, 7-6, 7-6, 5-7, 3-6 to reach the semi-finals

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Live coverage of the fourth and final T20 in the series from Trent Bridge, Nottingham. The last T20 series between the two sides took place in New Zealand in November 2019, as England came from 2-1 in the five-match series to win 3-2. In a rain-affected match, England reached New Zealand's score of 146 off 11 overs, winning the match via a Super Over, evoking memories of the World Cup final from just four months previously
